question:
A _________ is a networking device that filters network traffic while connecting multiple computers or communicating devices.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• A switch is a networking device that filters network traffic and connects multiple computers or devices within a local area network (LAN).
  • It forwards data only to the device for which the data is intended, improving network efficiency.
  • Other options:
    • Gateway connects different networks and translates protocols.
    • Router directs data packets between networks.
    • Repeater regenerates signals to extend transmission distance.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Switch.

Additional Information:

  • Switches operate at the data link layer (Layer 2) of the OSI model.
  • They reduce collisions by creating separate collision domains for each connected device.
  • Switches can be managed or unmanaged.
  • They play a vital role in network performance and security.

question:
Which of the following is the maximum file size that can be attached to an email message in Gmail?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The maximum file size that can be attached directly to an email message in Gmail is 25 MB.
  • If you try to attach files larger than 25 MB, Gmail automatically uploads them to Google Drive and sends a link instead.
  • Other options (50 MB, 100 MB, 200 MB) exceed Gmail’s attachment limit.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) 25 MB.

Additional Information:

  • Gmail integrates with Google Drive to handle large file sharing.
  • Using Google Drive links ensures recipients can download large files without email size restrictions.
  • Compressing files can help keep attachment size under the limit.
  • This limit applies per individual attachment, total email size can be larger with multiple attachments.

question:
What should you click to choose the date for sorting in Gmail?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
option_2: The ‘1 Day’ dropdown menu
solution:
• To choose the date for sorting or filtering emails in Gmail, you use the ‘Date within’ field in the advanced search options.
  • This field lets you specify the time range for emails to filter or sort by date.
  • Other options like calendar icon, ‘1 Day’ dropdown, or filter icon do not specifically provide date selection for sorting.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) The ‘Date within’ field.

Additional Information:

  • Gmail’s advanced search allows filtering emails based on various parameters including date.
  • Using the ‘Date within’ field helps find emails received within a certain number of days.
  • The filter icon opens the search options but date selection is done via the ‘Date within’ field.
  • This helps in efficient email management and retrieval.

question:
Which of the following types of firewall operates at the Network layer to examine incoming and outgoing packets?

CHSL 2023 Tier-II
solution:
• A Packet filtering firewall operates at the Network layer (Layer 3) of the OSI model.
  • It examines incoming and outgoing packets based on source and destination IP addresses, ports, and protocols.
  • Other options:
    • Circuit-level gateway works at the session layer.
    • Application-level gateway works at the application layer.
    • Network filtering is a general term but not a specific firewall type.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Packet filtering.

Additional Information:

  • Packet filtering firewalls are the simplest and fastest type of firewalls.
  • They make decisions based on predefined rules to allow or block traffic.
  • While efficient, they do not inspect the payload of packets deeply.
  • Often used as the first line of defense in network security.

question:
When the sender and receiver of an email are on the same system, we need only _________ user agents.

CGL 2023 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• When the sender and receiver of an email are on the same system, only two user agents are needed: one for the sender and one for the receiver.
  • User agents are the email client programs that allow users to compose, send, receive, and read emails.
  • Other options (three, four, six) are not applicable in this scenario.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Two.

Additional Information:

  • User agents interact with mail servers when sending or receiving emails over a network.
  • If both users are on the same system, email transfer is handled locally.
  • This setup is simpler compared to sending emails over a network.
  • Understanding user agents is key to managing email communication.

question:
A/an __________ is an organisation that connects its subscriber’s computer using modem to the Internet.

CGL 2023 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• An Internet Service Provider (ISP) is an organization that connects its subscribers' computers to the Internet, often using a modem.
  • ISPs provide access to the internet along with related services like email, web hosting, and domain registration.
  • Other options:
    • Web Server hosts websites.
    • Web Browser is software used to access websites.
    • Uniform Resource Locator (URL) is the address of a web resource.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Internet Service Provider.

Additional Information:

  • ISPs offer various connection types such as DSL, cable, fiber optics, and wireless.
  • They play a crucial role in internet accessibility for individuals and organizations.
  • ISPs may also provide technical support and security services.
  • Choosing a reliable ISP is important for stable internet connectivity.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an example of web browser?

CGL 2023 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Facebook is NOT a web browser; it is a social networking website and platform.
  • Apple Safari, Google Chrome, and Opera are popular web browsers used to access websites on the internet.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Facebook.

Additional Information:

  • Web browsers allow users to view, navigate, and interact with web pages.
  • Browsers interpret HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to display web content.
  • Facebook is accessed through web browsers but is itself a website/application.
  • Understanding the difference helps in correctly identifying software and platforms.

question:
Which networking device operates at Layer 2 of the OSI model and forwards data based on MAC addresses?

CGL 2023 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• A switch operates at Layer 2 (Data Link Layer) of the OSI model.
  • It forwards data packets based on MAC (Media Access Control) addresses to the correct device within a local network.
  • Other options:
    • Firewall monitors and controls network traffic based on security rules.
    • Router operates at Layer 3 (Network Layer) and forwards packets based on IP addresses.
    • Hub operates at Layer 1 (Physical Layer) and broadcasts data to all connected devices without filtering.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Switch.

Additional Information:

  • Switches reduce network collisions by sending data only to the intended recipient.
  • They maintain a MAC address table to keep track of connected devices.
  • Switches improve network performance and security compared to hubs.
  • Managed switches offer advanced features like VLANs and traffic prioritization.

question:
Which of the following is an example of GUI-based user agent in email?

CGL 2023 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Netscape is an example of a GUI-based user agent for email.
  • It provides a graphical user interface (GUI) to access and manage emails easily.
  • Other options:
    • Mail is a general term and can refer to many clients.
    • Pine and Elm are text-based email clients (command-line).
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Netscape.

Additional Information:

  • GUI-based email clients allow users to interact with emails using windows, icons, and menus.
  • Netscape was one of the first popular browsers and email clients with GUI.
  • Text-based clients like Pine and Elm require command-line knowledge.
  • GUI clients are generally more user-friendly for most users.

question:
A ________ is an electronic device that receives a weak signal and regenerates it.

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• A Repeater is an electronic device that receives a weak or distorted signal and regenerates it to its original strength and quality.
  • It is used to extend the transmission distance in networks by amplifying signals.
  • Other options:
    • Switch connects devices within a network and forwards data based on MAC addresses.
    • Router directs data packets between different networks.
    • Hub connects multiple devices but does not regenerate signals.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Repeater.

Additional Information:

  • Repeaters operate at the physical layer (Layer 1) of the OSI model.
  • They help overcome signal attenuation and noise in communication lines.
  • Repeaters are essential in long-distance wired and wireless communications.
  • Without repeaters, signals would degrade and become unusable over long distances.

question:
In which of the following modes of data transmission, can the data flow in both directions but in only one direction at a time?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier-I
solution:
• In Half-duplex mode, data can flow in both directions, but only one direction at a time.
  • Devices take turns to send and receive data but cannot do both simultaneously.
  • Other options:
    • Simplex allows data flow in only one direction.
    • Full-duplex allows simultaneous two-way data flow.
    • Quarter-duplex is not a standard term in data transmission.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Half-duplex.

Additional Information:

  • Half-duplex communication is used in devices like walkie-talkies and CB radios.
  • It helps conserve bandwidth by preventing collisions in data transmission.
  • Understanding duplex modes is important for network and communication design.
  • Half-duplex is simpler and cheaper compared to full-duplex systems.

question:
Which of the following is used to view pages and navigate the World Wide Web?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier-I
solution:
• A Web Browser is used to view pages and navigate the World Wide Web (WWW).
  • It allows users to access websites, view web content, and interact with online resources.
  • Other options:
    • Joystick is a gaming device, not related to web navigation.
    • Hyperlink is a link on a webpage that directs to another page.
    • World Wide Web is the system of interlinked web pages itself, not a tool to view them.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Web Browser.

Additional Information:

  • Popular web browsers include Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Safari.
  • Browsers interpret HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to display web pages.
  • They provide features like bookmarks, tabs, and extensions.
  • Web browsers are essential for internet use and accessing online information.

question:
________ is the physical network of computers all over the world.

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier-I
solution:
• The Internet is the physical network of computers all over the world connected together.
  • It is a global system of interconnected computer networks that use the Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP) to communicate.
  • Other options:
    • Laptop is a personal computer device.
    • Web browser is software to access websites.
    • Server is a computer that provides services to other computers.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Internet.

Additional Information:

  • The Internet enables global communication, data sharing, and access to information.
  • It connects millions of private, public, academic, business, and government networks.
  • The infrastructure includes routers, cables, satellites, and servers.
  • It forms the backbone for services like email, web, and streaming.

question:
Which of the following is keyboard shortcut to reload the current page in Google search engine?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The keyboard shortcut to reload or refresh the current page in most web browsers, including Google Search, is F5.
  • Pressing F5 reloads the page to fetch the latest content from the server.
  • Other options like F1, F3, and F7 perform different functions (help, find, spell check).
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) F5.

Additional Information:

  • Alternatively, pressing Ctrl + R also reloads the page.
  • Refreshing a page helps in updating dynamic content or fixing loading issues.
  • F1 generally opens help in most applications.
  • Knowing browser shortcuts improves browsing efficiency.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an example of e-mail service provider?

I. Outlook

II. Gmail

III. Yandex

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
option_3: All are e-mail service providers
solution:
• Outlook, Gmail, and Yandex are all examples of e-mail service providers.
  • They offer email services including sending, receiving, and managing emails over the internet.
  • Hence, all three options listed are valid email service providers.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is (c) All are e-mail service providers.

Additional Information:

  • Outlook is provided by Microsoft.
  • Gmail is provided by Google.
  • Yandex is a popular email service provider primarily used in Russia.
  • Email service providers may also offer additional services like calendar, contacts, and cloud storage.

question:
_________ is a passage to connect two networks that may work on different networking models.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• A Gateway is a device that acts as a passage to connect two different networks which may work on different networking models or protocols.
  • It translates data between different network architectures and protocols.
  • Other options:
    • Router directs data packets between networks using the same protocol.
    • Hub connects devices within the same network without translation.
    • Switch forwards data within the same network based on MAC addresses.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Gateway.

Additional Information:

  • Gateways operate at multiple layers of the OSI model depending on the functions they perform.
  • They enable communication between different network protocols such as Ethernet and Token Ring.
  • Gateways are crucial in integrating heterogeneous networks.
  • They often include protocol converters, translators, or routers.

question:
While _________ , data transfers from the customers’ machine to the server.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• While uploading, data transfers from the customer's machine to the server.
  • Uploading means sending files or data from a local device to a remote server or system.
  • Other options:
    • Downloading is transferring data from the server to the customer's machine.
    • Browsing refers to navigating web pages.
    • Forwarding means sending data onwards to another destination.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Uploading.

Additional Information:

  • Uploading is commonly used for sharing files, sending emails with attachments, and posting content online.
  • It requires an active internet connection from the user's device to the server.
  • Understanding upload and download is important for managing data flow on the internet.
  • Upload speed is often slower than download speed in many internet connections.

question:
________ is a type of dedicated file storage device that provides local-area network (LAN) users with centralized, consolidated disk storage through a standard Ethernet connection.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Network Attached Storage (NAS) is a type of dedicated file storage device that provides Local Area Network (LAN) users with centralized, consolidated disk storage through a standard Ethernet connection.
  • NAS allows multiple users and client devices to retrieve data from centralized disk capacity.
  • Other options:
    • Solid-State Drive (SSD) is a storage device but not specifically networked.
    • USB Hard Drives and USB Sticks are portable storage devices connected directly to a computer.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Network Attached Storage (NAS).

Additional Information:

  • NAS devices simplify data management and sharing across a network.
  • They often support data redundancy and backup features.
  • NAS can serve files via protocols like NFS, SMB/CIFS, or FTP.
  • They are widely used in homes and businesses for shared storage.

question:
_________ are rules that exist at several levels in a telecommunication connection.

CGL Exam 2022 Tier-I
solution:
• Protocols are sets of rules that exist at several levels in a telecommunication connection.
  • They define how data is transmitted, received, and interpreted between devices.
  • Other options:
    • Bandwidth is the capacity of a communication channel.
    • Domain Name is the human-readable address of a website.
    • Network Surface Unit is not a standard term in telecommunications.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Protocol.

Additional Information:

  • Protocols operate at different layers of the OSI or TCP/IP models.
  • Examples include HTTP, FTP, TCP, IP, and SMTP.
  • They ensure reliable and standardized communication.
  • Understanding protocols is essential for networking and internet functionality.

question:
Some cookies are automatically recreated after a user has deleted them. These are called as ________ cookies.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Cookies that are automatically recreated after a user has deleted them are called Zombie cookies.
  • Zombie cookies are stored outside the regular cookie storage areas and can regenerate themselves even after deletion.
  • Other options:
    • Session cookies last only for the browser session.
    • Persistent cookies remain on the device until they expire or are deleted.
    • Third party cookies are set by domains other than the one the user is visiting.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Zombie.

Additional Information:

  • Zombie cookies pose privacy and security concerns as they track users without consent.
  • They are difficult to remove because they hide in multiple locations like Flash storage or HTML5 storage.
  • Modern browsers and privacy tools work to block or remove zombie cookies.
  • Awareness of zombie cookies helps users manage online privacy better.

question:
Which of the following option can be pressed to create a new email message in Gmail?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• To create a new email message in Gmail, you click the Compose button.
  • The Compose option opens a new window to write and send an email.
  • Other options:
    • Drafts stores emails saved for later editing.
    • Settings allows changing Gmail preferences.
    • Outbound is not a standard Gmail option.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Compose.

Additional Information:

  • The Compose button is usually located at the top-left corner in Gmail’s interface.
  • Keyboard shortcut “C” also opens a new compose window in Gmail.
  • Drafts are useful for saving unfinished emails.
  • Understanding Gmail interface helps in efficient email management.

question:
_______ is also known as protocol convertor.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• A Gateway is also known as a protocol converter.
  • It connects two different networks that may use different protocols and translates the data between them.
  • Other options:
    • Hub connects devices but does not convert protocols.
    • Bridge connects two segments of the same network.
    • Switch connects devices within a LAN based on MAC addresses.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Gateway.

Additional Information:

  • Gateways operate at multiple layers of the OSI model depending on their function.
  • They enable communication between different network architectures like Ethernet and Token Ring.
  • Gateways can perform protocol translation, data conversion, and address mapping.
  • They are essential in integrating heterogeneous networks.

question:
In web browser, which of the following is responsible for displaying the web pages?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• In a web browser, the Rendering Engine is responsible for displaying web pages.
  • It interprets HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to render the content visually on the screen.
  • Other options:
    • Server hosts the web pages but does not display them.
    • Page engine is not a standard term.
    • Search engine helps find web pages but doesn’t display them.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Rendering engine.

Additional Information:

  • Popular rendering engines include Blink (Chrome), Gecko (Firefox), and WebKit (Safari).
  • The rendering engine processes the Document Object Model (DOM) and styles to layout the page.
  • It handles reflows and repaints as the user interacts with the page.
  • Understanding rendering engines helps in web development and browser optimization.

question:
Which among the following keyboard shortcuts is used to bookmark the current webpage on the web browser?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The keyboard shortcut to bookmark the current webpage in most web browsers is Ctrl + D.
  • Pressing Ctrl + D opens the bookmark dialog to save the current page for easy access later.
  • Other options:
    • Ctrl + I typically opens the italic formatting in text editors.
    • Ctrl + B usually toggles bold formatting.
    • Ctrl + N opens a new browser window or document.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Ctrl + D.

Additional Information:

  • Bookmarking helps users quickly access their favorite or important web pages.
  • Bookmarks can be organized into folders within the browser.
  • Most browsers also provide a star icon for bookmarking pages.
  • Learning keyboard shortcuts improves browsing efficiency.

question:
Which of the following Internet protocol specifies how data is exchanged over the Internet and how it should be broken into IP packets?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) specifies how data is exchanged over the Internet and how it should be broken into packets for transmission.
  • TCP ensures reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data between applications.
  • Other options:
    • HTTP is used for transferring web pages.
    • PPP (Point-to-Point Protocol) is used for direct connections between two nodes.
    • SMTP is used for sending emails.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) TCP.

Additional Information:

  • TCP works with the Internet Protocol (IP) in the TCP/IP suite to ensure data reaches the destination correctly.
  • It manages packet sequencing, retransmission of lost packets, and flow control.
  • TCP is connection-oriented, establishing a connection before data transfer.
  • Understanding TCP is key to grasping internet communication.

question:
A ________ port transmits one bit of a byte at a time as a single stream of bits. It is meant for transmitting slow data over long distances.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• A Serial port transmits one bit of a byte at a time as a single stream of bits.
  • It is designed for transmitting slow data over long distances.
  • Other options:
    • Universal Serial Bus (USB) is a modern serial communication standard but not a traditional serial port.
    • Display port is used for video output.
    • Parallel port transmits multiple bits simultaneously.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Serial.

Additional Information:

  • Serial ports are commonly used for communication with modems, printers, and other peripherals.
  • They use fewer wires compared to parallel ports, reducing cost and complexity.
  • Data transmission speed is slower compared to parallel ports but more reliable over long distances.
  • Serial communication protocols include RS-232, RS-485.

question:
In Gmail, what do you use when you receive a mail and want to send the mail in response of the same mail and to the original sender only?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
option_3: Both Reply and Forward
solution:
• In Gmail, when you want to send a response to the original sender only, you use the Reply option.
  • Reply sends your response directly back to the sender of the email.
  • Other options:
    • Forward sends the email to a new recipient.
    • Reply All sends the response to the sender and all other recipients.
    • Both Reply and Forward is incorrect as they serve different purposes.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Reply.

Additional Information:

  • Reply is useful for private or one-to-one communication.
  • Forwarding is used to share the email with others not in the original conversation.
  • Reply All should be used carefully to avoid unnecessary emails to multiple recipients.
  • Understanding these options helps manage email communication effectively.

question:
A ________ is a networking device that filters network traffic while connecting multiple computers or communication devices.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• A Switch is a networking device that filters network traffic while connecting multiple computers or communication devices within a network.
  • It forwards data only to the intended recipient based on MAC addresses, improving network efficiency.
  • Other options:
    • Router connects different networks and routes data between them.
    • Repeater amplifies and regenerates signals to extend network range.
    • Distributor is not a standard networking device.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Switch.

Additional Information:

  • Switches operate at the Data Link Layer (Layer 2) of the OSI model.
  • They reduce collisions by creating separate collision domains.
  • Switches can be managed or unmanaged, with advanced features in managed switches.
  • Using switches enhances network speed and security compared to hubs.

question:
________ was the first browser to display images inline with text instead of displaying images in a separate window.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The first browser to display images inline with text (instead of in a separate window) was Mosaic.
  • Mosaic revolutionized web browsing by integrating text and images on the same page.
  • Other options:
    • Mozilla came much later as a browser based on Netscape.
    • Opera and Lynx had different features but were not the first for inline images.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Mosaic.

Additional Information:

  • Mosaic was developed in 1993 at the National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA).
  • It greatly contributed to the popularization of the World Wide Web.
  • Its user-friendly interface helped make the web accessible to the general public.
  • Mosaic eventually evolved into Netscape Navigator.

question:
________ are a set of wires, which carries a group of bits in parallel and has an associated control scheme. It provides a communication path between two or more devices of a computer system.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Buses are a set of wires that carry a group of bits in parallel and have an associated control scheme.
  • They provide a communication path between two or more devices within a computer system.
  • Other options:
    • Control Unit manages the operations of the CPU.
    • Cache is a small, fast memory for temporary data storage.
    • Register is a small storage location within the CPU.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Buses.

Additional Information:

  • Buses can be data buses, address buses, or control buses depending on their function.
  • They enable the transfer of data, addresses, and control signals between components.
  • Buses are essential for the internal communication of computer hardware.
  • Wider buses allow more data to be transferred simultaneously, improving performance.

question:
Which of the following is a web browser created and developed by Microsoft?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Microsoft Edge is the web browser created and developed by Microsoft.
  • It is the successor to Internet Explorer and is built on the Chromium engine for better performance and compatibility.
  • Other options:
    • Opera is developed by Opera Software.
    • Brave is developed by Brave Software.
    • Chrome is developed by Google.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Edge.

Additional Information:

  • Microsoft Edge supports modern web standards and features like extensions, privacy controls, and integration with Microsoft services.
  • It is available on Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android platforms.
  • Edge replaced Internet Explorer as the default Windows browser.
  • Knowing different browsers helps in choosing the right one for your needs.

question:
Which one of the following folders is used to store deleted emails?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The folder used to store deleted emails is the Trash folder.
  • When you delete an email, it is moved to Trash before being permanently removed.
  • Other options:
    • Inbox stores received emails.
    • Spam stores junk or unsolicited emails.
    • Drafts stores emails saved for later editing and sending.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Trash.

Additional Information:

  • Emails in Trash can be recovered until the folder is emptied.
  • Trash helps prevent accidental permanent deletion.
  • Some email services automatically empty Trash after a certain period.
  • Managing Trash is important for email organization and storage space.

question:
Which of the following are the computer programs that are designed by attackers to gain root or administrative access to your computer?

RRB JE 30/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Rootkits are computer programs designed by attackers to gain root or administrative access to a computer without detection.
  • They allow attackers to maintain privileged access while hiding their presence.
  • Other options:
    • Antiware refers to software designed to protect against malicious software.
    • Backdoors are methods or programs that bypass normal authentication, but rootkits specifically maintain hidden control.
    • Malware is a general term for malicious software including viruses, worms, trojans, etc.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (b) Rootkits.

Additional Information:

  • Rootkits can be very difficult to detect and remove.
  • They operate at the operating system or firmware level.
  • Attackers use rootkits to steal data, monitor activity, or control the system.
  • Regular security updates and antivirus scans help prevent rootkit infections.

question:
Which of the following is an attack in which the user receives unwanted amount of e-mails?

RRB JE Stage-II 30/08/2019 (Shift-III)
solution:
• An Email bomb is an attack where the user receives an unwanted large amount of emails, overwhelming their inbox.
  • This type of attack aims to disrupt email services and cause inconvenience or denial of service.
  • Other options:
    • Spoofing involves impersonating another user or device.
    • Smurfing is a network-level attack using ICMP echo requests.
    • Ping storm involves flooding a network with ping requests.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Email bomb.

Additional Information:

  • Email bombing can cause storage overload and slow down email servers.
  • It is a form of Denial of Service (DoS) attack targeting email systems.
  • Anti-spam filters and rate limiting help mitigate such attacks.
  • Users should avoid clicking suspicious links or sharing their email publicly to reduce risk.

question:
What is the meaning of letter ‘s’ in ‘https’ Protocol?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• In the protocol HTTPS, the letter ‘s’ stands for Secure.
  • HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP, providing encrypted communication and secure identification of a network web server.
  • Other options like Scale, Save, or Software are incorrect meanings for ‘s’ in HTTPS.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Secure.

Additional Information:

  • HTTPS uses SSL/TLS protocols to encrypt data transmitted between the browser and server.
  • It ensures data privacy, integrity, and authentication.
  • Websites using HTTPS display a padlock icon in the browser address bar.
  • Secure browsing protects against eavesdropping and man-in-the-middle attacks.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an internet browser?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Panda is NOT an internet browser; it is commonly known as antivirus software.
  • Safari, Firefox, and Chrome are popular web browsers used to access and navigate the internet.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) Panda.

Additional Information:

  • Safari is developed by Apple, Firefox by Mozilla, and Chrome by Google.
  • Web browsers allow users to view websites and interact with online content.
  • Antivirus software like Panda protects computers from malware but does not browse the web.
  • Knowing the difference helps avoid confusion between software types.

question:
The first page that you normally view at a Website is-

RRB JE Stage-II 31/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The first page that you normally view at a website is called the Home page.
  • It serves as the main entry point and provides navigation to other sections of the website.
  • Other options:
    • First page and Front page are general terms but not the official term.
    • Master page is a web design template, not the initial page.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Home page.

Additional Information:

  • The home page often contains important links, menus, and overview content.
  • It helps users understand the purpose and structure of the website.
  • Web developers design the home page to be user-friendly and attractive.
  • The URL of the home page is usually the root domain (e.g., www.example.com).

question:
Which of the following servers covert IP addresses to domain names?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 28/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The server that converts IP addresses to domain names is called a DNS (Domain Name System) server.
  • DNS translates human-readable domain names (like www.example.com) into IP addresses that computers use to identify each other on the network.
  • Other options:
    • Email servers handle email sending and receiving.
    • Cloud Services provide storage and computing resources over the internet.
    • P2P (Peer-to-Peer) refers to a decentralized communication model, not address translation.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) DNS.

Additional Information:

  • DNS is often referred to as the "phonebook" of the internet.
  • It improves usability by allowing users to remember domain names instead of numeric IP addresses.
  • DNS servers are distributed globally to ensure fast and reliable domain resolution.
  • Understanding DNS is key to grasping how the internet functions.

question:
Which of the following is required to create an HTML document?

RRB JE CBT-II 28/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• To create an HTML document, you need a Text editor.
  • A text editor allows you to write and save HTML code in plain text format.
  • Other options:
    • Search engine helps find information on the internet but does not create documents.
    • Internet is not necessary to create an HTML file locally.
    • Browser is used to view HTML documents, not to create them.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (c) Text editor.

Additional Information:

  • Popular text editors include Notepad, Sublime Text, Visual Studio Code, and Atom.
  • After writing the HTML code, you save the file with an .html extension.
  • Browsers render the HTML file to display the webpage.
  • Knowing how to use a text editor is fundamental for web development.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a Google product?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 28/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• iTunes is NOT a Google product; it is developed by Apple Inc.
  • Gmail, Blogger, and YouTube are all Google products.
  • Hence, the correct answer is (a) iTunes.

Additional Information:

  • Gmail is Google’s email service.
  • Blogger is a blog-publishing service owned by Google.
  • YouTube is a video-sharing platform owned by Google.
  • iTunes is a media player and store developed by Apple, primarily for its devices.
